article.headline: VMI 102, UNC Asheville 97
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. (AP) -- Reggie Williams scored 34 points to lead six VMI players in double digits Monday as the Keydets defeated UNC Asheville 102-97. Travis Holmes added 17 points for the Keydets (9-12, 2-3 BSC), who held off a last-ditch Bulldog comeback to secure their first win against UNC Asheville since joining the Big South Conference three years ago. Matt Murrer finished with 14 points, Chavis Holmes added 13, and Fred Robinson and Willie Bell scored 11 points apiece for VMI. UNC Asheville (6-14, 2-4 BSC) took a 92-91 lead with four minutes left on Vincent James' two free throws, but VMI answered with an 8-0 run to take the lead for good. The Bulldogs cut the lead to 99-97 with 37 seconds left, but Williams was fouled and made 1-of-2 free throws and Murrer dunked for the final score. The Bulldogs had a season-high 29 turnovers that VMI converted into 32 points. VMI turned over the ball just 11 times and had 19 steals. Joey Harrell led five Bulldogs in double-digit scoring with a career-high 21 points. Freshman Sean Smith added a career-best 16 points, Vincent James chipped in 15 points, and K.J. Garland scored 14 points. Donovan Jones had a double-double with 13 points and 10 rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
